channel.title: Hypocrite Reader
channel.description: An online monthly, of essays conceptual and timely, based in Brooklyn, New York.

item.title: The Student’s Blush
item.description: not the doctor famous for his oath - wisdom is a calculus of pleasures - an agonistic logic of its own - Thrasymachus getting angry - blind spots that he can exploit - the other Platonic reflex, laughter

item.title: Facebook
item.description: I don’t use OKCupid - public and private, virtual semiocapital - the message of the piece is unambiguous - not dark enough to be Yves Klein’s blue - Coca-Cola, Jacques Derrida, NYC - a novel called Facebook

item.title: Confession
item.description: do you want to make out - a cask and a casket - two lies underpin a confession - a rare event unfolds - and more of them below

item.title: The Five Senses
item.description: this is no fragrant ode for weekends - the likes of artichoke - dreams of my opposite - some sort of wieldy élan - between epsilon and epaulet - O!

item.title: Talking to Dirt
item.description: half-Sharpie’d on the breast - the infant-bug resemblance - a bongo -themed rave going on in my chest cavity - I wanted so desperately to create a perfect sphere - secret nervous snail self - the true core of its being: dirt
Illustration by Ellis Calvin

item.title: The Gods Show Up
item.description: two poles of the erotic - home for Dionysos - gods are complete and simple - hesitant hen-pecked - counsel of the chorus

item.title: On Severalness
item.description: they do not exist in the limen - but which thing - I am compassionate and over-sensitive - the self I was for her - a kind of Holi - embodiment of my face - a sin against authenticity

item.title: Tender Violations
item.description: or, if the porno has a storyline - the tickler and the tickled - the « money shot » - a comeuppance to her impotent husband - Straw Dogs - « cheers from feminists » - a fragment of consent - hand-to-hand combat - magic circle - How can one be deflated without being full of hot air? - skipping to the punchline

item.title: Afterthought to “A Robo-Poet Does Not Scare Us”

item.description: “Funny Story” by Ellis Calvin

item.title: On the Jerk
item.description: moments of intense humiliation - what color the walls were - my hand shot up - what a little turd! - the iron law of egos - when the event burst through the door - certain vicissitudes or derivations - Louis CK and Jerking Off - half the studio audience would be openly sobbing - Baudelaire, That Jerk - a prose poem from Paris Spleen entitled « Beat the Poor »

item.title: I find America before Paul Simon can
item.description: downing weak cups of coffee at the Waffle House, - listening to the waitresses sigh about daughters

item.title: At the Front Line of the Punch Line: Or, Simone Weil goes to War
item.description: an anarchist militia - Simone Weil - uncompromising politics and inventive theology - Buenaventura Durruti - playing the clown - expectation transformed into nothing - the Dad-Humor Phenomenon - smash the lightbulb with a hammer - a pitchfork in the air

item.title: Cremains
item.description: my grandmother’s urn tucked under his arm - unbreakable, waterproof, light-tight and ugly - 1 hour per 100 lbs. of body - Do The Honors - The first myth about « spreading ashes » - dance around rusted anchors - U.S. law forbids the cremation of - cracked irreparably
